He has represented England at [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. ==Club career== ===Plymouth Argyle=== Born in [[Wadebridge]], Cornwall, Walton began his career with [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] aged 10 and progressed through the club's [[youth system]]. He was named in a matchday squad for the first time three days after his 16th birthday for an [[FA Cup]] first round tie against [[Stourbridge F.C.|Stourbridge]], in which he remained an unused [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]], the match finishing 3–3.{{cite web |title=Plymouth 3–3 Stourbridge |url=http://www.pafc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10364~61283,00.html |publisher=Plymouth Argyle F.C. |date=12 November 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111114140910/http://www.pafc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10364~61283%2C00.html |archivedate=14 November 2011 |deadurl=yes}} ===Brighton & Hove Albion and loan spells=== On 15 February 2013, Walton signed for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]], where he completed his scholarship, before signing a three-year professional contract in the summer of 2013.{{cite web |first=Will |last=Jago |title=Albion sign Christian Walton |url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2013/february/albion-sign-christian-walton/ |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=15 February 2013 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} He was twice an unused substitute in consecutive matches in [[2013–14 Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. season|2013–14]], a 3–1 win at home to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on 7 December,{{cite news |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 3–1 Leicester City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25163803 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 December 2013 |accessdate=25 June 2016}} prior to a 1–0 win away to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] one week later.{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 0–1 Brighton & Hove Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25275222 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 December 2013 |accessdate=25 June 2016}} Ahead of [[2014–15 Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. season|2014–15]], Walton signed a new four-year contract with the club on 8 July 2014.{{cite news |title=Brighton: Jake Forster-Caskey and Christian Walton sign new deals |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28216271 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 July 2014 |accessdate=29 October 2014}} He was an unused substitute on the opening day of the season in a 1–0 defeat at home to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].{{cite news |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–1 Sheffield Wednesday |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28646509 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2016}} Walton made his professional debut for Brighton aged 18 in a 2–0 defeat away to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] fourth round on 29 October.{{cite news |first=David |last=Hytner |title=Tottenham cruise into last eight as Érik Lamela and Harry Kane sink Brighton |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/oct/29/tottenham-brighton-capital-one-cup-match-report |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=29 October 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2016}} He made his [[English Football League|Football League]] debut six days later in a 1–0 win at home to [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]].{{cite news |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Wigan Athletic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29797381 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 November 2014 |accessdate=23 February 2017}} Walton made his second consecutive start in a 1–1 draw at home to [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] on 8 November.{{cite news |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–1 Blackburn Rovers |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/29860092 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 November 2014 |accessdate=25 June 2016}} He returned to the [[starting lineup]] on the final day of the season in a 0–0 draw away to Middlesbrough, his first appearance since November.{{cite web |title=Report: Middlesbrough 0 Albion 0 |url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2015/may/middlesbrough-v-albion-/ |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=2 May 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} In addition to his four appearances for Brighton, Walton also kept two [[clean sheets]]. On 21 July 2015, Walton signed for newly promoted [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] on a season-long [[Loan (sports)|loan]].{{cite news |title=Christian Walton: Bury sign Brighton & Hove Albion keeper |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33608899 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 July 2015 |accessdate=4 October 2015}} He made his debut for Bury in a 1–1 draw at home to [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] on the opening day of [[2015–16 Bury F.C. season|2015–16]].{{cite web |first=Michael |last=Brown |title=Match report: Bury 1–1 Doncaster Rovers |url=https://www.buryfc.co.uk/news/2015/august/match-report-bury-1---1-doncaster-rovers/ |publisher=Bury F.C. |date=8 August 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} Walton returned to Brighton on 1 September due to an underlying groin injury, having made six appearances for Bury.{{cite web |first=Paul |last=Camillin |title=Walton returns |url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2015/september/walton-returns/ |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=1 September 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} On 19 November 2015, Walton joined former club Plymouth Argyle on loan until 3 January 2016 as cover for the injured [[Luke McCormick]].{{cite web |first=Paul |last=Camillin |title=Walton joins Argyle on loan |url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2015/november/walton-joins-argyle-on-loan/ |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=19 November 2015 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} He made his Plymouth debut in a 2–1 defeat at home to arch-rivals [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]] two days later.{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Errington |title=Plymouth Argyle 1 Exeter City 2: Match report |url=http://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/Plymouth-Argyle-1-Exeter-City-2-Match-report/story-28218039-detail/story.html |newspaper=Plymouth Herald |date=21 November 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151125125800/http://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/Plymouth-Argyle-1-Exeter-City-2-Match-report/story-28218039-detail/story.html |archivedate=25 November 2015 |deadurl=yes}} Walton started in three further matches, and returned to Brighton upon the expiration of his loan spell.{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Errington |title=Goalkeeper Christian Walton returns to Brighton after Plymouth Argyle loan ends |url=http://www.plymouthherald.co.uk/goalkeeper-christian-walton-returns-brighton/story-28457304-detail/story.html |newspaper=Plymouth Herald |date=3 January 2016 |accessdate=25 June 2016}}{{dead link|date=February 2018}} On 24 June 2016, Walton signed for [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] on a season-long loan, linking back up with [[Nathan Jones (Welsh footballer)|Nathan Jones]] who was [[first-team]] coach for his first three years at Brighton.{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Hatters sign Seagulls keeper on season-long loan |url=https://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/hatters-sign-seagulls-keeper-on-season-long-loan-1-7448076 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=24 June 2016 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} He made his Luton debut on the opening day of [[2016–17 Luton Town F.C. season|2016–17]] in a 3–0 win away to Plymouth Argyle.{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Hatters head to the top after superb Plymouth win |url=https://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/hatters-head-to-the-top-after-superb-plymouth-win-1-7515160 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=6 August 2016 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} Walton saved a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] from [[Vadaine Oliver]] during a 0–0 draw away to [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] on 29 October to keep a clean sheet for Luton, which extended the club's unbeaten league run to seven matches and earned him a place in the English Football League Team of the Week.{{cite web |first=Alex |last=Butcher |title=Sky Bet EFL: Team of the Week |url=https://www.efl.com/news/2016/october/sky-bet-efl-team-of-the-week5/ |publisher=English Football League |date=31 October 2016 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} He was recalled by Brighton on 31 January 2017 following an injury to fellow goalkeeper [[Niki Mäenpää]], having made 33 appearances for Luton and conceded the fewest goals in League Two during his loan spell.{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Deadline day: Brighton recall keeper Walton from Luton |url=https://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/deadline-day-brighton-recall-keeper-walton-from-luton-1-7799344 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=31 January 2017 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} On 1 April 2017, Walton signed for League One club [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] on an emergency loan for an initial seven days as cover for [[Ted Smith (footballer, born 1996)|Ted Smith]] who had sustained a wrist injury.{{cite news |title=Christian Walton: Brighton goalkeeper joins Southend as emergency cover |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39466810 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 April 2017 |accessdate=1 April 2017}}{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Phillips |title=Blues snap up goalkeeper Walton on loan from Brighton |url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/sport/blues/15197542.Blues_snap_up_goalkeeper_Walton_on_loan_from_Brighton/ |newspaper=The Echo |location=Basildon |date=1 April 2017 |accessdate=1 April 2017}} He debuted later that day in a 3–0 victory at home to [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]].{{cite news |title=Southend United 3–0 Oldham Athletic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39389230 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 April 2017 |accessdate=1 April 2017}} It was agreed for Walton's loan to be extended by a further week as the club were still without a fit goalkeeper.{{cite news |first=Andy |last=Naylor |title=Brighton and Hove Albion goalkeeper Christian Walton staying at Southend United |url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15212491.Albion_goalie_kept_for_longer_by_Southend/ |newspaper=The Argus |location=Brighton |date=8 April 2017 |accessdate=8 April 2017}} The goalkeeping situation remained unchanged and therefore the loan was extended by a further week once more.{{cite news |first=Brian |last=Owen |title=Christian Walton stays on loan at Southend United for another week |url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15227632.Walton_stays_at_Southend_for_another_week/ |newspaper=The Argus |location=Brighton |date=16 April 2017 |accessdate=17 April 2017}} Walton's loan was extended again to enable him to play in Southend's final match of [[2016–17 Southend United F.C. season|2016–17]],{{cite news |first=Brian |last=Owen |title=Christian Walton cleared to play for Southend United in play-off decider |url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/albion/15256078.Walton_clear_for_action_in_play_off_decider/ |newspaper=The Argus |location=Brighton |date=30 April 2017 |accessdate=30 April 2017}} and completed the loan spell with seven appearances. On 12 July 2017, Walton signed for League One club Wigan Athletic on a season-long loan.{{cite news |title=Christian Walton: Wigan Athletic sign Brighton goalkeeper on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40582430 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 July 2017 |accessdate=13 July 2017}} He made his debut for Wigan on the opening day of [[2017–18 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2017–18]] in a 1–0 victory away to [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]]. Walton finished the loan with 35 appearances, as Wigan won the League One title and [[Promotion and relegation|promotion]] to the Championship.{{cite web |title=League One: 2017/18: Latest table |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/tournaments/tournament.sd?tourn_id=1568 |website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=5 May 2018}} He re-signed for Wigan on another season-long loan on 22 June 2018, with a recall option in January 2019.{{cite news |title=Christian Walton: Wigan Athletic re-sign Brighton goalkeeper on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44576851 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 June 2018 |accessdate=22 June 2018}} ==International career== Walton was called up to the [[England national under-19 football team|England under-19 team]] for a [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendly]] against [[Turkey national under-19 football team|Turkey]] on 5 March 2014.{{cite web |first=Jamie |last=Reid |title=Noel Blake names England U19s squad for Turkey fixture |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/feb/24/blake-names-u19s-squad-for-turkey |publisher=The Football Association |date=24 February 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} He entered the match as a 76th-minute substitute for [[Mitchell Beeney]], the match finishing a 3–0 win.{{cite web |first=Jamie |last=Reid |title=England U19s shine in Chester as Young Lions beat Turkey |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/mar/05/england-v-turkey-match-report |publisher=The Football Association |date=5 March 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} Walton received his first call-up to the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] for a friendly against [[Romania national under-19 football team|Romania]],{{cite web |first=Jamie |last=Reid |title=Aidy Boothroyd names U20 squad to face Romania |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/aug/28/boothroyd-names-his-first-u20-squad |publisher=The Football Association |date=28 August 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} in which he won his first [[Cap (sport)|cap]].{{cite web |first=Jamie |last=Reid |title=Boothroyd's boys hit Romania for six in Telford |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2014/sep/05/england-v-romania-u20-match-report-050914 |publisher=The Football Association |date=5 September 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2017}} He was first called up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] on 25 August 2015 for their matches against the [[United States men's national under-23 soccer team|United States under-23 team]] and [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway under-21 team]].{{cite news |first=Ben |last=Collins |title=Duncan Watmore and Bury keeper Christian Walton named in England Under-21 squad |url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/duncan-watmore-bury-keeper-christian-9925531 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |date=25 August 2015 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} However, he was forced to withdraw from the squad six days later after sustaining a groin injury playing for Bury in a 1–1 draw with Oldham Athletic.{{cite news |first=Craig |last=Nelson |title=Bury keeper Christian Walton is withdrawn from England U21 squad |url=http://www.burytimes.co.uk/sport/13636844.Bury_keeper_Christian_Walton_is_withdrawn_from_England_U21_squad/ |newspaper=Bury Times |date=31 August 2015 |accessdate=12 October 2016}} Walton received his next under-21 call-up on 3 October 2016 for two [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification]] matches against [[Kazakhstan national under-21 football team|Kazakhstan]] and [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national under-21 football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]].{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Luton keeper earns England U21 call-up |url=https://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/luton-keeper-earns-england-u21-call-up-1-7609189 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=3 October 2016 |accessdate=18 February 2018}} He won his first cap and kept a [[clean sheet]] in England's 5–0 win over Bosnia and Herzegovina on 11 October.{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Clean sheet for Luton keeper on England U21s debut |url=https://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/clean-sheet-for-luton-keeper-on-england-u21s-debut-1-7624419 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=11 October 2016
